mlneuro.regression.neuralnets¶

class mlneuro.regression.neuralnets.DenseNNBinnedRegressor(units=[100, 200, 300, 100, 50], dropout=0.3, num_epochs=20, ybins=32, optimizer='adam', activation='relu', verbose=0, loss=None, weighted_kl_constant=0.1)[source]¶

Bases: sklearn.base.BaseEstimator, mlneuro.regression.base.BinnedRegressorMixin

Class for the dense (fully-connected) neural network decoder :param units: The number of hidden units in each layer, can be a single integer for one layer :type units: array-like, integers, shape [n_layers] :param dropout: Proportion of units that get dropped out, if 0, no dropout layer is included :type dropout: decimal from [0,1] :param num_epochs: Number of epochs used for training :type num_epochs: integer, optional, default 10 :param optimizer: The Keras optimizer to use for training :type optimizer: string or object :param activation: The Keras activation type for the dense layers :type activation: string or object :param loss: The Keras string defined loss function (e.g. ‘kullback_leibler_divergence’) for a function that takes

y_true, y_pred and produces a float value for loss (must use tensor math). By default, uses distance weighted KL-divergence
Parameters:
  • weighted_kl_constant (float) – The constant added to the distances for weighted KL-divergence loss function. Larger values will allow the estimator to fit near but not exactly on the bin of interest.
  • verbose (binary, optional, default=0) – Whether to show progress of the fit after each epoch
fit(X, y, **fit_params)[source]¶

Construct the neural network model and fit it with the training data :param X: This is the neural data.

See example file for an example of how to format the neural data correctly
Parameters:y (array-like, shape [n_samples, n_outputs]) – This is the outputs that are being predicted
predict_proba(X)[source]¶

Predict using the trained network

Parameters:X (array-like, shape [n_samples,n_features]) – Test samples
Returns:y_test_predicted (array-like, shape [n_samples,n_outputs]) – The predicted outputs
class mlneuro.regression.neuralnets.DenseNNRegressor(units=[100, 200, 100, 50], dropout=0, num_epochs=20, optimizer='adam', activation='relu', verbose=0)[source]¶

Bases: sklearn.base.BaseEstimator, sklearn.base.RegressorMixin

Class for the dense (fully-connected) neural network decoder :param units: The number of hidden units in each layer, can be a single integer for one layer :type units: array-like, integers, shape [n_layers] :param dropout: Proportion of units that get dropped out, if 0, no dropout layer is included :type dropout: decimal from [0,1] :param num_epochs: Number of epochs used for training :type num_epochs: integer, optional, default 10 :param optimizer: The Keras optimizer to use for training :type optimizer: string or object :param activation: The Keras activation type for the dense layers :type activation: string or object :param verbose: Whether to show progress of the fit after each epoch :type verbose: binary, optional, default=0 :param Modified from the KordingLab: :param https: :type https: //github.com/KordingLab/Neural_Decoding/blob/master/decoders.py

class mlneuro.regression.neuralnets.LSTMRegressor(units=400, dropout=0, num_epochs=30, verbose=0)[source]¶

Bases: sklearn.base.BaseEstimator, sklearn.base.RegressorMixin

Firing rate based long-term short-term memory neural network based estimator

Parameters:
  • units (integer, optional, default 400) – Number of hidden units in each layer
  • dropout (decimal, optional, default 0) – Proportion of units that get dropped out
  • num_epochs (integer, optional, default 10) – Number of epochs used for training
  • verbose (binary, optional, default=0) – Whether to show progress of the fit after each epoch
  • from the KordingLab (Modified) –
  • https (//github.com/KordingLab/Neural_Decoding/blob/master/decoders.py) –
fit(X, y, **kwargs)[source]¶

Train LSTM Decoder :param X: This is the neural data.

See example file for an example of how to format the neural data correctly
Parameters:y (array-like, shape [n_samples, n_outputs]) – This is the outputs that are being predicted
predict(X_test)[source]¶

Predict outcomes using trained LSTM Decoder

Parameters:X_test (numpy 3d array of shape [n_samples,n_time_bins,n_neurons]) – This is the neural data being used to predict outputs.
Returns:y_test_predicted (array-like, shape [n_samples,n_outputs]) – The predicted outputs
